intro: Psychotria triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces small, white to pale green flowers that are clustered in threes, giving it its common name. Its leaves are usually ovate to elliptic in shape and have a smooth, glossy surface. Psychotria triflora is often found in lowland rainforests and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture.
